info.title: ApplicationCharge
info.description:
The ApplicationCharge resource facilitates one-time charges. This type of charge is recommended for apps that arenâ€™t billed on a recurring basis. You can create an application charge by sending a request with the name the charge should appear under, the price your app is charging, and a return URL where Shopify redirects the merchant after the charge is accepted. After you've created the charge, redirect the merchant to the confirmation URL returned by Shopify. If the charge is declined, then Shopify redirects the merchant and provides a notification message that the app charge was declined. For step-by-step guidance that walks through this flow using examples, see our implementation guide.

Note

For testing purposes you can include "test": true when creating the charge. This prevents the credit card from being charged. Test shops and demo shops can't be charged.

name: can't be blank
price: must be greater than or equal to 0.5
must be greater than or equal to 0.5

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"application_charge":{"name":"Super Duper Expensive action","price":100.0,"return_url":"http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

application_charge = ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
application_charge.name = "Super Duper Expensive action"
application_charge.price = 100.0
application_charge.return_url = "http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"
application_charge.save()

x-examples.name: Create a test charge that will not cause a credit card to be charged

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"application_charge":{"name":"Super Duper Expensive action","price":100.0,"return_url":"http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com","test":true}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

application_charge = ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
application_charge.name = "Super Duper Expensive action"
application_charge.price = 100.0
application_charge.return_url = "http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"
application_charge.test = true
application_charge.save()

response.body: {"errors":{"name":["can't be blank"],"price":["must be greater than or equal to 0.5"]}}

x-examples.name: Trying to create a charge without a price or name will return an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"application_charge":{"name":""}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

application_charge = ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
application_charge.name = ""
application_charge.save()

response.body: {"errors":{"price":["must be greater than or equal to 0.5"]}}

x-examples.name: Trying to create a charge with a price less than 0.50 will return an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"application_charge":{"name":"Super Duper Expensive action","price":0.4,"return_url":"http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

application_charge = ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.new(session: test_session)
application_charge.name = "Super Duper Expensive action"
application_charge.price = 0.4
application_charge.return_url = "http://super-duper.shopifyapps.com"
application_charge.save()

paths.description: Retrieves a list of application charges
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of application charges

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

200.description: Retrieves a list of application charges

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.all(
  session: test_session,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all application charges since a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges.json?since_id=556467234" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.all(
  session: test_session,
  since_id: "556467234",
)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/application_charges/675931192.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::ApplicationCharge.find(
  session: test_session,
  id: 675931192,
)

properties.description: The URL where the merchant accepts or declines the application charge.
properties.name: confirmation_url

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the application charge was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The ID of the application charge.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The price of the application charge. The minimum price is 0.50, and maximum price is 10,000.
properties.name: price

properties.description: The URL where the merchant is redirected after accepting a charge.
properties.name: return_url

properties.description:
The status of the application charge. Valid values:

  • pending: The application charge is pending approval by the merchant.
  • accepted: Removed in version 2021-01. The application charge has been accepted by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app. At this point it will appear on the merchant's invoice. As of API version 2021-01, when a merchant accepts a charge, the charge immediately transitions from pending to active.
  • active: The application charge has been activated by the app and will be paid out to the Partner.
  • declined: The application charge was declined by the merchant.
  • expired: The application charge was not accepted within 2 days of being created.
properties.name: status

properties.description: Whether the application charge is a test transaction. Valid values:true,null.
properties.name: test

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the charge was last updated.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Charge a shop a one-time fee by creating an application charge.
